results.task_name: Create a workunit with full details
results.prompt_sent: I need to track some work on fixing our login page. Create a workunit named "Fix Login Page Bug" in project 3bbc76f68d484a79bd4f63a874816eec. The problem is that users can't log in when they have special characters in their password. We'll know it's done when all character types are supported and there are regression tests. Make it high priority.

tool_calls.name: create_workunit

arguments.name: Fix Login Page Bug
arguments.problem_statement: Users can't log in when they have special characters in their password.
arguments.success_criteria: All character types are supported and regression tests added.

results.task_name: Add three tasks to a workunit
results.prompt_sent:
Add these three tasks to workunit 88d90031c8bc42508155b6f36658d16f:
1. "Reproduce the bug locally" - high priority
2. "Identify root cause" - high priority  
3. "Write fix and add regression tests" - normal priority

All should start as todo.
model_responses: Task created. Now create second task.
details: Expected task title not found: 'Write fix and add regression tests'

results.prompt_sent: Save a context note on workunit 88d90031c8bc42508155b6f36658d16f recording this decision: we chose to fix the password validation on the backend rather than the frontend, because it's more secure. This is a high-importance architectural decision.

arguments.title: Password validation backend fix
arguments.content: We decided to implement password validation on the backend instead of the frontend. This ensures that all validation logic is enforced server‑side, preventing clients from bypassing checks and providing a single source of truth for security rules.
